definition: to neglect/to skip (class or work)/to waste (time)/vast/loose-fitting

sentences.english: Some of your people will also need to bedismissed because of excessive absenteeism.
sentences.chinese: 你的某些員工，經常曠工，因而也需要被開除。

sentences.english: First, robots never get sick, so absenteeism would be reduced.
sentences.chinese: 首先，機器人從不生病，從而曠工將會減少。

sentences.english: A few thoughtless people commented on his absence.
sentences.chinese: 有幾個沒頭腦的人談到了他的曠工。

sentences.english: His boss discharged him for habitual absenteeism.
sentences.chinese: 他的老闆因他習慣性曠工而解僱了他。

sentences.english: Total personal leave is less than 6 working days, or considered to be absent from work.
sentences.chinese: 每年的事假天數不得超過6個工作日，否則視爲曠工。

sentences.english: Improvements of working conditions helped to reduce levels of absenteeism.
sentences.chinese: 工作條件的改善已令曠工率降低。

sentences.english: Ye Xintong said that some people don't behave properly, arbitrarily absenteeism.
sentences.chinese: 葉辛桐說有人不守規矩，隨意曠工。

sentences.english: He hasn't missed a day's work in years.
sentences.chinese: 他多年來一天也未曠工。
